oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The power of mobility: Four membranes suffice
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KRISHNA, SN
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We continue the study of P systems with mobile membranes introduced in [6], which is a variant of P systems with active membranes having none of the features like polarizations, label change and division of non-elementary membranes. This variant was shown to be universal using only the simple operations of endocytosis and exocytosis; moreover, if elementary membrane division is allowed, it is capable of solving hard problems. Here, we investigate the power of the two operations (endocytosis, exocytosis) in more detail: 2 membranes can generate sets of vectors outside PsMAT, and four membranes give universality.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 1st Conference on Computability in Europe (CiE 2005),Amsterdam, NETHERLANDS,JUN 08-12, 2005
